whitelist_philosophy: Only include vendors that are UNAMBIGUOUSLY business expenses. High precision over high recall. Better to miss some expenses than to flood with false positives.

cloud_infrastructure.name: Cloud Infrastructure
cloud_infrastructure.rationale: Software infrastructure - always business for a developer

domain_dns.name: Domain & DNS Services
domain_dns.rationale: Domain registrations are business assets for software developer

saas_services.name: SaaS & Business Services
saas_services.rationale: API services and payment processing for business

professional_development.name: Professional Development
professional_development.rationale: Technical education directly related to software development profession

banking_fees.name: Banking & Payment Fees
banking_fees.rationale: Business banking and payment processing fees

excluded_ambiguous.reason: These vendors require human review - could be personal or business
removed_vendors: apple.com (could be personal subscriptions or business hardware)
best buy, newegg (hardware stores - need to see what was purchased)
office depot, staples (could be personal office supplies)
zoom, slack (consumer plans vs business plans unclear from description)

matching_rules.description: Whitelist approach: Only flag transactions with HIGH CONFIDENCE of being business expenses

usage_notes: Goal: High precision (95%+ accuracy) over high recall
Missing expenses should be caught through other methods (manual review, AI, etc.)
Better to have 50 accurate flags than 500 that need review
